messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] being with your child
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/25/03 1:15:07 AM, abtleo@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/25/03 1:15:07 AM, abtleo@... writes:

<< I just had to laugh at the irony of you reading this great stuff about
really spending time with your kids, while your kids (and dh) stood around
waiting for you to spend time with them. Too funny!

<<Hope you have a fun trip. >>

That is amusing,
but I bet the trip was more fun for it!

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] being with your child
messages.msgSnippet: I know!  I know! I m still learning!    And unfortunately the only way I learn those things is reading.  But I have been spending less time on the computer,
messages.messageBody:
I know! I know!

I'm still learning! And unfortunately the only way I learn those things is reading. But I have been spending less time on the computer, more time with the kids. Notice--less posts from me!

I am going to post a few this morning tho'. Kids are still sleeping.

Kelli



Kelli


Alan & Brenda Leonard <abtleo@...> wrote:2/25/03 05:26:

> I have to agree, we were getting ready to leave for a few days and there I
> was stuck to the computer, reading that thread. Kids and dad, standing,
> tapping their feet, "OK, Mom, lets go, we're ready!"
>
> I really think the part about how important it is for new unschoolers to spend
> lots of time with their kids and really listening and 'being' with them was so
> great.

Kelli,

I just had to laugh at the irony of you reading this great stuff about
really spending time with your kids, while your kids (and dh) stood around
waiting for you to spend time with them. Too funny!

Hope you have a fun trip.

brenda
